definitions: To push a sharp or pointed object into or through something.
To adhere or cause to adhere to a surface or substance.
To become fixed in a particular position or unable to move.
To tolerate or endure something unpleasant.
To remain loyal to a person, group, or belief.
examples: She will stick the needle into the fabric.
The mud will stick to your boots.
The door will stick if it's humid.
I don't know how much more I can stick.
He will stick by his friends.
